title.narrative: SOCIAL BEHAVIOR CHANGE FOR CHILD PROTECTION

description.narrative: Traditional and religious leaders, parents and communities, including adolescents in target areas, have increased knowledge and capacity for the adoption of practices and behaviours conducive to birth registration, protection of children against abuse, violence and exploitation and abandonment of child marriage, including in humanitarian situations., which contributes to Evaluation And Research, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, especially the most vulnerable, including girls and those in humanitarian situations, are protected from violence, abuse, exploitation and child marriage within their families and communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Traditional and religious leaders, parents and communities, including adolescents in target areas, have increased knowledge and capacity for the adoption of practices and behaviours conducive to birth registration, protection of children against abuse, violence and exploitation and abandonment of child marriage, including in humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: The programme continued to equip the communities with knowledge and skills and to empower adolescents to address violence and harmful practices and to promote positive social norms. The community-based child protection approach was scaled up to 198 new villages in the Maradi, Tahoua and Zinder regions, reaching more than 49,000 adolescents girls thanks to the funds of the global programme to end child marriage and the spotlight initiative. The community networks in the region of Diffa including the child protection and social cohesion committees continued to play a crucial role in addressing child protection issues in the humanitarian context. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2020
